title: Four D.C. men arrested in connection with car thefts in Maryland
text:
Four Washington men have been arrested and charged in connection with stealing 30 vehicles and another 100 incidents of thefts from vehicles throughout Montgomery County, authorities said.

Montgomery County Police said the incidents happened between May and August.

The suspects include Khristian Markeel Champ, 20; Duan Jones, 20; and Christopher Taylor, 19; all of Southeast; along with Alaunte Scott, 18, of Northwest. They face a variety of charges, including auto theft and theft from vehicle.

Officials said the men stole 30 vehicles and committed 100 thefts from vehicles in the county. During their investigation, police said they found several vehicles in the District that had been stolen from the county.

Detectives figured out that the men were “working together to commit a series of auto thefts and thefts from vehicles” in the county.

Jones, Champ and Taylor posted bond and were released. A court summons was issued for Scott, police said.



From left to right, Khristian M. Champ, Duan Jones, Christopher Taylor were accused of a variety of charges involving stealing 30 vehicles and thefts from 100 vehicles in Montgomery County. (Montgomery County Police)
